International fact-finding group leaves
articles.content:
International fact-finding group leaves 
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The international group to probe the truth behind GIs' war crimes headed by former U.S. attorney general Ramsey Clark left here yesterday.
 It was seen off by Choe Jong Hwan, vice-chairman of the Korean Democratic Lawyers Association, at the airport.

articles.title: U.S. move to form new army brigades
articles.content:
U.S. move to form new army brigades 
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) - The U.S. army is attempting to organise  brigades based on a "new conception," which can be deployed in the Korean peninsula from the mainland within four days, under the pretext of "coping with an emergency," according to a report.
 It was reported that two brigades would be formed by next year and the maneuverability and fire power of these brigades would be much greater than the existing brigades to play the role of a U.S. army task force.    
 This clearly proves that the bush administration is working hard to ignite the second war of aggression in Korea.

Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of Han Ju Gyong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of Han Ju Gyong 
    Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il yesterday sent a wreath to the bier of lieutenant general of the KPA Han Ju 
Gyong, lecturer at the victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, expressing deep condolences over his death.
